paragraphs.name: 22c0
paragraphs.text: “It’s hard to make an IRS auditor laugh,” one told me. “But this would do it.”

The point of my stories was not to defeat Trump. The point was to tell readers the facts about this man running for president. How reliable was he at keeping promises? How much moral responsibility did he feel to help those less fortunate than he?
paragraphs.name: ad03

paragraphs.text: “I shot myself in the eye with a glitter gun,” I said. I showed him the Party Popper, which I had brought with me, in case he wanted to send it off to the National Institute of Morons for further study.

1d5a47d306c.title: David, I followed your reporting on WaPo, Twitter, and on cable news and I never saw such a dogged…

paragraphs.text: David, I followed your reporting on WaPo, Twitter, and on cable news and I never saw such a dogged investigative journalist in any Presidential campaign in my lifetime do what you did this election cycle. I look forward to your close reporting on the Trump administration for as long as freedom of the press remains the law of the land.
paragraphs.name: d0c5

f04dfc78351f.title: I follow you on twitter and had been following the charity story for a while.

paragraphs.text: I follow you on twitter and had been following the charity story for a while. Absolutely fascinating, especially how the power of social media contributed to your search. Congratulations on your Pulitzer!
paragraphs.name: cb2c

paragraphs.text: Wow, David. This is even more amazing then the reporting you have been doing that we have all been edgily following for the past year. Truly an amazing saga. There are many American’s who are very thankful for what you’ve done, Americans who are in awe of your determination and courage and grateful for revealing the man behind the curtain.
paragraphs.name: ab94

paragraphs.text: Thank you!
Jeanne

b70ee9381de.title: Early in this article you used a word about the tRump machine that screams at me and should at…

paragraphs.text: Early in this article you used a word about the tRump machine that screams at me and should at everyone — — Secret. Thing done under the cloak of darkness so no one really knows what you are doing or how much you are lying. AMEN. That sums DJT up in one word. It’s a shame people did not heed what you have written.
paragraphs.name: f531

paragraphs.text: That is damn fine writing. And reporting. People fail to recall here in the 21st century the prescience of Kurt Vonnegut. After reading your story here, all I could think was God bless you, Mr Rosewater.
paragraphs.name: 5c21

paragraphs.text: I love this ☺
paragraphs.name: dfae

paragraphs.text: Very nicely done. Too bad you are not a time traveller. Even a little improvement on the current situation would be welcome. What you now need to figure out (and do not really need me to tell you) is how to get people to pay attention to these vain, self-serving, actions. If you can do that, you may still make a difference. I predict you will not suffer from a lack of material.
paragraphs.name: c251

deb205075cc5.title: Why didn’t this so-called “journalist” cover Obama’s administration with this same zeal?

paragraphs.text: Why didn’t this so-called “journalist” cover Obama’s administration with this same zeal? Or how about investigating Hillary Clinton and the “pay for play” deals she made, or the Clinton Foundation’s involvement in laundering Russian money while Hillary gave the Russians twenty percent of all US uranium ore while Secretary of State?
paragraphs.name: 16d8

virtuals.subtitle: This so-called “journalist” thinks that, because money was sitting in the Trump Foundation, that it wasn’t “spent.” Of course it was spent…

content.subtitle: This so-called “journalist” thinks that, because money was sitting in the Trump Foundation, that it wasn’t “spent.” Of course it was spent…

d89472483f61.title: One picture is still worth a thousand words … Bill O’Leary nailed it!

paragraphs.text: One picture is still worth a thousand words … Bill O’Leary nailed it!

Applause for David Fahrenthold’s dogged, objective reporting and a Shout Out for Brilliance to Bill O’Leary for his photo illustration that, in one fell swoop, foreshadows an eerie, not-so-futuristic city-scape.

185c8e52ad77.title: Where is the truth about Benghazi?

paragraphs.text: Where is the truth about Benghazi? You can diminish a positive act but not expound on obvious negligence? Nothing wrong with your writing it is your choice of a thin story over a truly important one that makes you just another hack.
paragraphs.name: b9b3

11643a63d603.title: Amazing. You spent a whole year investigating Trump and a million dollars.

paragraphs.text: Amazing. You spent a whole year investigating Trump and a million dollars. Along the way you hit all the garbage talking points that the people who elected Trump realized were biased.
paragraphs.name: 82b8

paragraphs.text: Nice article
Outstanding journalism on 2 counts. Old school leg work and crisp writing. Both art forms that are being lost. Bravo @Fahrenthold
paragraphs.name: f110

2212926464.title: Thank you for what you do. It is vitally important work and gives me reason to hope.

paragraphs.text: Thank you for what you do. It is vitally important work and gives me reason to hope.
Trump like The Emerald. His campaign was long and controversial. But in the end he still won.
paragraphs.name: 3c2a

3dd4cd140314.title: As neither a Trump nor a Hillary supporter, I find your journalism to be exactly that.

paragraphs.text: As neither a Trump nor a Hillary supporter, I find your journalism to be exactly that. Fair, unbiased, and simply truth telling.
paragraphs.name: 301b

paragraphs.text: How refreshing.

paragraphs.text: I would say that you cut your teeth on tRump I and now you really have your work cut out for you for the next god knows how long. I’ll be waiting to read with bated breath.

f5a70dfedb06.title: Washington Post David — Your story of The Cave reminded me of what the contraction OPM stands for…

paragraphs.text: Washington Post David — Your story of The Cave reminded me of what the contraction OPM stands for in the investment community: Other People’s Money. That’s pretty spot-on.
